hints.content:
We can think of subtraction as:

$\maroonD{\text{total}} - \blueE{\text{part}} = \goldE{\text{ part}}$

We can also think of subtraction as:

$\maroonD{\text{total}} - \goldE{\text{ part}} =  \blueE{\text{part}}$

So, we can subtract $\goldE{57}$ from $\maroonD{94}$ to find the missing $\blueE{\text{part}}$.

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/f13ccbf4c4f5c5022649c1e8030623f08ddc8c29)

question.content:
**What number makes this equation true?**  
*Hint: Use the place value blocks to help solve.*

$94 - {}$ [[☃ numeric-input 1]] $=57$  

![](web+graphie:${☣ LOCALPATH}/images/e4df133467bfd845ec595b1df64cc3da2e64e8be)
